meanings.definition: A person of unusually small stature, often considered offensive when used to describe individuals with dwarfism.
meanings.sent1: The circus featured talented midgets performing tricks.
meanings.sent2: The group of midgets gathered for a photo at the convention.
meanings.sent3: The movie about tiny midgets trying to save the world was both funny and heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: In the land of giants, the midgets stood out like colorful flowers in a field of grass.
meanings.sent5: The image of the midgets dancing in the spotlight stayed with the audience long after the show ended.

meanings.sent1: The midgets puppies played joyfully in the park.
meanings.sent2: She carried a midgets bag that held all her essentials.
meanings.sent3: The midgets kitten tried to climb the tall tree but got stuck halfway up.
meanings.sent4: The midgets house at the end of the street looked cozy and inviting.
meanings.sent5: The midgets plant in the garden bloomed with vibrant colors despite its small size.
